title.#text: Predation on a cryptic rainforest rodent ( sp.) by a carpet python ()

author.details: The School for Field Studies, PO Box 141, Yungaburra, Qld 4884, Australia.
The School for Field Studies, PO Box 141, Yungaburra, Qld 4884, Australia.
Scats About, PO Box 45, Majors Creek, NSW 2622, Australia.
The School for Field Studies, PO Box 141, Yungaburra, Qld 4884, Australia.

front.abstract: The tree mouse (Pogonomys sp.) is a cryptic species from north-east Queensland. We report the first known predation of this species by a reptile, the carpet python (Morelia spilota), based on the identification of hair retrieved from a road-killed python. We describe characteristics of the hair sample and comment on implications that diverse foraging strategies in a reptilian predator may have for prey behaviour and vulnerability.
front.keywords: Atherton Tablelands, hair identification, tropical rainforest, Wet Tropics.
